articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 9th in F (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 9th in F (Shape: E)

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio is a 9th chord in the key of F major, utilizing the shape of an E major chord. It consists of the notes F, A, C, E, and G. The F major 9 arpeggio adds a richness and jazzy color to the sound due to the inclusion of the 9th (G).

## Notes and Intervals
- F (Root)
- A (Major 3rd)
- C (Perfect 5th)
- E (Major 7th)
- G (Major 9th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, soul, and R&B music genres. It contributes a sophisticated and melodic feel to the music, creating a lush and colorful sound. The addition of the 9th interval adds a sense of tension and resolution, enhancing the harmonic depth and complexity.

## Songs
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis**: This jazz classic features the F major 9 arpeggio prominently in the improvisational sections, showcasing its expressive and harmonic capabilities.
   
2. **"Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder**: This soulful song incorporates F major 9 arpeggios in the chord progressions, adding a smooth and romantic vibe to the music.
   
3. **"Watermelon Man" by Herbie Hancock**: A funky jazz fusion tune that utilizes the F major 9 arpeggio to create a groovy and sophisticated sound palette.
